awd_titl_txt: Quasi-biennial Variability in the Extratropical Circulation and Ozone
awd_abstract_narration: This project will use a global 3-D stratospheric model to                  study the effect of the tropical quasi-biennial oscillation (QBO)               on the extratropical wintertime circulation and tracer transport,               with Rossby wave propagation providing the coupling mechanism.  A               tracer advection scheme will be used along with the 3-D                         mechanistic model, to estimate the extratropical quasi-biennial                 variability in ozone (or other quasi-conservative tracer)                       concentration associated with the circulation modulation by the                 equatorial QBO.  This research is important because it provides                 the basis for inhanced theoretical understanding of how low-                    frequency oscillations (the QBO) interact with other weather and                climate phenomena.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
